elements.title: La Nube (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the children's museum La Nube (pictured) includes a bus-washing exhibit?

elements.title: Rico Krieger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that German national Rico Krieger was likely forced by the Belarusian KGB to lie in a state-televised plea titled "Confession of a German Terrorist"?

elements.title: electrification of the Midland Main Line (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although the electrification of the Midland Main Line was designated as a high priority in 1981, work to electrify the northern part of the line did not begin until more than 30 years later?

elements.title: Huang Shaoqiang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Huang Shaoqiang produced numerous paintings condemning the Japanese invasion of China?

elements.title: Trust Issues (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2019 single "Trust Issues" by Drake was originally released in 2011 as a free download?

elements.title: The Life Eaters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2003 graphic novel The Life Eaters, presenting an occult-driven, hypothetical Axis victory in World War II, has been discussed in the context of its portrayal of The Holocaust?

elements.title: Battle of Tinzaouaten (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mali and Niger broke off diplomatic relations with Ukraine over the country's alleged support for rebel groups in the Battle of Tinzaouaten?

elements.title: Jordan Sepho (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic gold-medal-winning rugby player Jordan Sepho vomited from stress the first time he played?

elements.title: a viral dance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a viral dance in which performers mimic driving a car was performed by #Amishtiktok content creators, who substituted operating a horse and buggy?
